discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
he cause of the issue where Cisco Extension Mobility does not show up when the services key is pressed is most likely:

B. Cisco Extension Mobility Service is not running.

Explanation:
Cisco Extension Mobility relies on the Extension Mobility Service to function. If this service is not running, the feature will not be available on the phone, and pressing the services key will not show Cisco Extension Mobility as an option.

questions.question_text: When the services key is pressed Cisco Extension Mobility does not show up. What is the cause of the issue?

choices.C: The phone is not subscribed to Cisco Extension Mobility Service.
choices.B: Cisco Extension Mobility Service is not running.
choices.D: Cisco Extension Mobility is not enabled in the Phone Configuration Window (Device > Phone)
choices.A: The URL configured for Cisco Extension Mobility is not correct.

discussion.content: B should be correct. After unchecking "enable extension mobility" under phone in CUCM, the user name and password prompt disappeared from my phone.

choices.A: Create the default device profiles for all phone models that are used.
choices.D: Assign the extension as a mobile extension.
choices.B: Subscribe the phone to the Cisco Extension Mobility service.
choices.C: Create the end user and associate it to the device profile.

questions.question_text: A user reports when they press the services key they do not receive a user ID and password prompt to assign the phone extension. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.A: physical location, device pool, and Device Mobility group
choices.D: device pool, Device Mobility group, and Cisco IP phone
choices.B: device pool, Device Mobility group, and region
choices.C: physical location. Device Mobility group, and region

questions.question_text: What are the elements for Device Mobility configuration?

discussion.content:
Correct Answer D. c= attributes contained the connection media information. It contains the IP address that will be used for RTP.
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4566#section-5.7

Selected Answer: D
The C Field <c=> indicates the IP address where the media RTP should be sent to by the other end.

Selected Answer: D
There are two attributes required for each side to negotiate the RTP stream in SDP and this information is passed on the c= for IP and m= for Port and Codec(s).

D
C=connection information
while o=originator and session identifier

Correct Answer D. c= (Connection/IP address for RTP stream)
Reference: SDP Parameter

choices.B: Allow: header if the 200 OK response
choices.A: Contact: header of the 200 OK response

questions.question_text: End users at a new site report being unable to hear the remote party when calling or being called by users at headquarters. Calls to and from the PSTN work as expected. To investigate the SIP signaling to troubleshoot the problem, which field can provide a hint for troubleshooting?

choices.C: Cisco CallManager, Cisco TFTP, and Cisco Extension Mobility
choices.D: Cisco TAPS Service, Cisco TFTP, and Cisco Extension Mobility
choices.A: Cisco Extended Functions, Cisco Extension Mobility, and Cisco AXL Web Service
choices.B: Cisco CallManager, Cisco TFTP, and Cisco CallManager SNMP Service

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Activate the following services as needed: 
a. Cisco CallManager 
b. Cisco Tftp 
c. Cisco Extension Mobility
